intro: Erucastrum balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. It has hairy, lobed leaves and produces small, elongated pods containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
